definition: lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: But he tried a third time, was accepted and marched into the history books.
sentences.chinese: 但他做了第三次尝试，最终被录取并且名垂青史。

sentences.english: He left a name in history as a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他作为民族英雄而名垂青史。

sentences.english: Both Adams and Leverrier are honored for discovering Neptune.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯和勒威耶两人都因发现了海王星而名垂青史。

definition: (of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to have one's name go down in history as a byword for infamy (idiom)
a good reputation to last a hundred generations
a good reputation to last down the generations
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
